title: Our Current Medical Establishment Would Have Botched COVID, The Same Way They Are Botching Measles

What would you have done?

Recently, an interviewer sympathetic to the Great Barrington Declaration (GBD) listened to my criticisms of it and asked me: What would you have done? That question has me bothered me ever since.

Unlike the doctors I critique, I never claimed to be a pandemic guru with all the answers, and what I actually did is exactly what I would have done. It’s trivially easy to write the words “I would have kept schools open” or “I would have protected the vulnerable.” Anyone can do it.

Obviously anyone can voice their opinion on how we could have better handled the pandemic, and it’s vital that we learn from what worked and what failed. However, the question “what would you have done?” conjures a parallel universe where words become reality, and both the virus and the public can be bent to one’s will.

Nonetheless, imagination time is fun, so here’s my answer:

I never would have let SAR-CoV-2 into the country. The moment the virus emerged in China, I would have sealed the border. If any COVID cases snuck in, I would isolate them before the virus could spread. I’d launch a massively successful vaccination campaign and ventilate indoor spaces. I’d create a culture where people stayed home when they were sick and where mask-wearing was not unusual. By keeping the virus out of the country, society could function normally, and people would remain healthy.

A reasonable person would not be impressed by this. They would expect to see a detailed plan to keep COVID out of the country, and even then they would spot its many obvious flaws.

Yet, many people did not demand such a plan from the GBD, although their proposal was as absurd as mine. They wanted 2/3 of the country live in a world of pure COVID and 1/3 of the country live in a world of zero COVID. They said this would end the pandemic in 3-6 months. Although though the virus shuttered schools and killed a record number of people when they ran the show in Florida, they claim that if only we had listened to them, everything would have been just fine.

While my plan of keeping the U.S. COVID-free is obviously superior to the GBD’s, I will receive zero credit for it. In contrast, the authors of the GBD and like-minded doctors received many accolades for merely saying what they would have done. However, recent events reveal just how absurd this adoration was.

Doctors who became celebrities for saying what they would have done, parlayed that game of make-believe into high positions in the Trump administration. They are the Medical Establishment now, and they no longer get to say what they would have done on Twitter and Fox News. They have real-world responsibility, and it’s a mess all around.

I don’t need to repeat all of the headlines of censorship and purges they are generating, but one thing they are doing is letting children suffer and die from vaccine-preventable diseases. Yes, measles is still the most contagious virus there is, but it should be easy to handle compared to COVID. We have a near-perfect vaccine, and most parents want it. Allaying the fears of vaccine-hesitant parents should be a top priority for our Medical Establishment. That’s not happening.

The doctors who claimed they would have solved COVID are flailing with measles- amongst other things. Not only are the failing to correct anti-vaccine disinformation, they are making things worse. In one recent interview, Dr. Marty Makary, flanked by the Food Babe(!), twice refused to answer “YES!” when asked if parents should vaccinate their children against measles. Despite their grand pronouncements, our current Medical Establishment wouldn’t have opened schools or protected the vulnerable when COVID was raging. Those were empty boasts. Right now, they are demonstrating their complete inability to keep people safe from a dangerous pathogens.
